text.text_translated: In a global survey carried out by PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), more than 40,000 people gave their answers about work. The survey included **millennials**. Millennials are people born between 1983 and 1993. It also included people from other age groups. The questions were about subjects such as work culture, communication, and working styles. They also asked about how people are paid, career development, and the balance between work and personal life. In a separate global survey by Deloitte, more than 10,000 millennials took part in a study. The study asked for their opinions about the good and bad things in the complicated world of work.
